zone.line: If I were writing in the Spenser
I would not praise you in heroic style
Let you are void of guile
And ready I believe, were others so
To be
And though because the Author is in Power
If I were one who held the world in awe
Or deemed myself a subject to its law
save & groan
I doubt not they wd. liberally phrase
All sorts of contradictions in his Praise
some declare
Your a familiar spirit — as you are —
Some with a bold conjecture more inhuman
Hint that though not my wife, you are a woman
What is the colour of your eyes & hair,
Why if you were a lady, it were fair
The world should know . . .but as I am afraid
The courts the Reviews
The Quarterly might bait you if betrayed
And as it will be droll to see them stumble
Over all sorts of scandal, hear them mumble
Their Litanies of curses — some guess right
And others swear you are an Hermaphrodite
Like that sweet marble monster of both sexes
soft
Who looks so soft & gentle, that it vexes
this very soul, that soul is gone
Which fear
Perhaps I wish you were one -
